author: Prakash Kamat
text:
Lashing out at the members of the Opposition, Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar said here on Sunday that the people of Goa should “keep them away from power” for at least 10-15 more years since politics has become a “lucrative business” for them.

Addressing party workers after releasing a BJP-backed committee’s election manifesto for the City Corporation of Panaji election this year, Mr. Parrikar said: “I don’t want to name them (Opposition politicians), but some of them have been land dealers, wheelers-dealers and commission agents for years. They have now made a lucrative business out of politics in Goa”.

The Minister charged that some Opposition politicians have amassed so much wealth through dishonest dealings that they have been carrying out sustained anti-BJP campaigns using vested interests in social media, electronic media and newspapers.

Asserting that some of them had been “rightly sent home” by the people in the 2012 Assembly elections, Mr. Parrikar said others had joined them by forming more groups and parties and were exploiting the emotions of Goans over issues the exclusion of coconut tree by from the Preservation of Trees Act.
title: Keep Opposition away from power, says Parrikar
